document.masterDocTitle: Checklist of decapod crustaceans from the coast of the São Paulo state (Brazil) supported by integrative molecular and morphological data: IV. Infraorder Anomura: Superfamilies Chirostyloidea, Galatheoidea, Hippoidea and Paguroidea

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Checklist of decapod crustaceans from the coast of the São Paulo state (Brazil) supported by integrative molecular and morphological data: IV. Infraorder Anomura: Superfamilies Chirostyloidea, Galatheoidea, Hippoidea and Paguroidea

Remarks.
Pachycheles laevidactylus
inhabits the intertidal region, in mussel beds, algae tufts, under rocks, associated with bryozoans, polychaetes ( Veloso & Melo 1993 ; Micheletti-Flores & Negreiros-Fransozo 1999 ;
Miranda et al. 2014
; Ferreira & Melo 2016 ) and on mussel farming ropes (
Macedo et al. 2012
). In the original description of
Pachycheles chubutensis , Boschi (1963)
described the morphological similarity between the new species and
Pachycheles laevidactylus
(as
Pachycheles haigae
). The validity of both as distinct species was confirmed by morphological and molecular analysis (
Miranda et al. 2014
). Sequences accession numbers (GenBank): CCDB 2379—16S ( MF490160 ), COI ( MF490056 ) (
Mantelatto et al. 2018
).
